Package org.magentatobe.jchessgame

Class Chessboard

java.lang.Object
org.magentatobe.jchessgame.Chessboard
public class Chessboard extends Object
Represents a chessboard, storing a data structure, an int[8][8] array, that it uses to keep track of the state of the board. That structure is available via Chessboard.getBoardArray() so it can be manipulated directly, such as by methods in BoardsArray or MinimaxRunner.

  • Constructor Details

    • Chessboard

      public Chessboard(ImagesManager imagesManager, int playingColor, int onTopColor)
      Instantiates the Chessboard object.
      Parameters:
      imagesManager - The program's ImagesManager object, which is used to retrieve piece images.
      playingColor - An integer representing the color the user is playing as, either BoardArrays.WHITE or BoardArrays.BLACK.
      onTopColor - An integer representing the color that's playing from the top of the board, either BoardArrays.WHITE or BoardArrays.BLACK.

    • Chessboard

      public Chessboard(int[][] boardArrayVal, ImagesManager imagesManager, int playingColor, int onTopColor)
      Instantiates the Chessboard object, including an initializing value for the board array.
      Parameters:
      boardArrayVal - The value for the board array.
      imagesManager - The program's ImagesManager object, which is used to retrieve piece images.
      playingColor - An integer representing the color the user is playing as, either BoardArrays.WHITE or BoardArrays.BLACK.
      onTopColor - An integer representing the color that's playing from the top of the board, either BoardArrays.WHITE or BoardArrays.BLACK.

  • Method Details

    • setColors

      public void setColors(int colorPlayingVal, int colorOnTopVal)
      Mutator method for the colorPlaying and colorOnTop instance variables.
      Parameters:
      colorPlayingVal - The new integer value representing the color the user is playing. One of either BoardArrays.WHITE or BoardArrays.BLACK.
      colorOnTopVal - The new integer value representing the color playing from the top of the board. One of either BoardArrays.WHITE or BoardArrays.BLACK.

    • layOutPieces

      public void layOutPieces()
      Resets the internal board array and populates it with the appropriate pieces. It places the color the user is playing at the bottom of the board and the color the AI is playing at the top.

    • getBoardArray

      public int[][] getBoardArray()
      Accessor for the boardArray instance variable, which is the internal int[8][8] array used to represent the chessboard.
      Returns:
      An int[8][8] array representing a chessboard. This value is not deepcopied; this is a reference to the Chessboard object's boardArray. Changes to this array will be reflected in the Chessboard object's state, and Chessboard operations that affect its board state will be reflected in this array.

    • setBoardArray

      public void setBoardArray(int[][] boardArrayVal)
      Mutator for the boardArray instance variable that represents the chessboard in play.
      Parameters:
      boardArrayVal - The int[8][8] array to set the boardArray instance variable to.

    • getColorOnTop

      public int getColorOnTop()
      Accessor for the colorOnTop instance variable, which indicates the color that is playing from the top of the board.
      Returns:
      The value of colorOnTop, either BoardArrays.WHITE or BoardArrays.BLACK;

    • getColorPlaying

      public int getColorPlaying()
      Accessor for the colorPlaying instance variable, which indicates the color the user is playing.
      Returns:
      The value of colorPlaying, either BoardArrays.WHITE or BoardArrays.BLACK;

    • promotePawn

      public void promotePawn(int xCoord, int yCoord, int newPiece)
      Promotes the pawn at the specified location. The pawn's integer value in the internal board array is replaced with the new value given, or'd with the color of the original piece.
      Parameters:
      xCoord - The x coordinate of the pawn to promote.
      yCoord - The y coordinate of the pawn to promote.
      newPiece - The integer value of the new piece to replace it with, not including the color flag.

    • getPieceAtCoords

      public Chessboard.Piece getPieceAtCoords(int[] coords)
      Instances a Chessboard.Piece object that represents the piece on the board in the square specified by the argument.
      Parameters:
      coords - An int[2] comprising the coordinates of the piece to instance a Piece object of.
      Returns:
      A Chessboard.Piece object representing the piece at that location.
      See Also:
      • Chessboard.Move

    • getPieceAtCoords

      public Chessboard.Piece getPieceAtCoords(int xCoord, int yCoord)
      Instances a Chessboard.Piece object that represents the piece on the board in the square specified by the arguments.
      Parameters:
      xCoord - The x coordinate of the piece to instance a Piece object of.
      yCoord - The y coordinate of the piece to instance a Piece object of.
      Returns:
      A Chessboard.Piece object representing the piece at that location.
      See Also:
      • Chessboard.Piece

    • isMovePossible

      public boolean isMovePossible(Chessboard.Move moveObj)
      Returns true if the Chessboard.Move argument represents a valid move for the piece involved, false if the move is illegal.
      Parameters:
      moveObj - The Chessboard.Move object to test for validity.
      Returns:
      A boolean, true if the move is a legal one for the piece at that location, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      • Chessboard.Move

    • isCastlingPossible

      public int isCastlingPossible(int colorOfKing, int kingOrQueen) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Checks whether the requirements for castling have been met. The two pieces must both have not moved since start of play, the squares between them must be empty, the king must not be in check, and both the king's destination square and the intervening squares must not be threatened. If all conditions are met, the method returns 0. Otherwise, it returns an int failure mode flag.
      Parameters:
      colorOfKing - An integer referring to the color of the king to check, either Chessboard.WHITE or Chessboard.BLACK
      kingOrQueen - An integer referring to king or queen, either Chessboard.KING or Chessboard.QUEEN. King indicates kingside castling, and queen indicates queenside castling.
      Returns:
      Int failure mode flag, one of the int flags defined in MovesLog.MoveError: MovesLog.MoveError.CASTLING_INTERVENING_SPACE_OCCUPIED, MovesLog.MoveError.CASTLING_KING_IN_CHECK, MovesLog.MoveError.CASTLING_PATH_IS_THREATENED, or MovesLog.MoveError.CASTLING_PIECE_HAS_MOVED.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

    • movePiece

      public void movePiece(Chessboard.Move moveObj) throws KingIsInCheckException, IllegalArgumentException, CastlingNotPossibleException
      Executes a Chessboard.Move object and moves the given piece or pieces on the object's internal chessboard model.
      Parameters:
      moveObj - The Chessboard.Move object describing the movement of a piece that movePiece will execute.
      Throws:
      KingIsInCheckException - If the move would put the friendly king in check, or the king is in check and this move doesn't change that.
      CastlingNotPossibleException - If the move is a castling but the castling is not possible because an intervening square is occupied or either the king or the rook has already moved.
      IllegalArgumentException

    • occupiedSquareCoords

      public int[][] occupiedSquareCoords()
      Returns a int[][2] array of the coordinates for every square on the board that is occupied by a piece of either color.
      Returns:
      An array of 2-element arrays as long as the number of pieces on the board.
